Class Human

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      • game.ZombieActor
        • game.Human
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ActorInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Farmer, Player

    public class Human
extends ZombieActor
    Class representing an ordinary human.
    Author:
    ram, Kee Pei Jiin

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class game.ZombieActor

        aiming, behaviours

      • Fields inherited from class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor

        displayChar, hitPoints, inventory, maxHitPoints, name

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
        Human(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a Human instance object using super() constructor and add a Behaviours object consist of a list of Behaviour (AttackBehaviour, EatingBehaviour and WanderBehaviour) to protected behaviours attribute in its parent class which is the ZombieActor class.
      protected Human(java.lang.String name, char displayChar, int hitPoints)
      The protected constructor can be used to create subtypes of Human, such as the Player

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      private void addHumanBehaviours()
      Add all Human Behaviour into behaviours.
      protected void extendHumanBehaviours(int index, java.util.List<Behaviour> newBehaviours)
      Insert a list of new Behaviour at specific positions of the existing Human behaviours.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Human

        public Human(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a Human instance object using super() constructor and add a Behaviours object consist of a list of Behaviour (AttackBehaviour, EatingBehaviour and WanderBehaviour) to protected behaviours attribute in its parent class which is the ZombieActor class.
        Parameters:
        name - the human's display name

      • Human

        protected Human(java.lang.String name,
                char displayChar,
                int hitPoints)
        The protected constructor can be used to create subtypes of Human, such as the Player
        Parameters:
        name - the human's display name
        displayChar - character that will represent the Human in the map
        hitPoints - amount of damage that the Human can take before it dies

    • Method Detail

      • addHumanBehaviours

        private void addHumanBehaviours()
        Add all Human Behaviour into behaviours.

      • extendHumanBehaviours

        protected void extendHumanBehaviours(int index,
                                     java.util.List<Behaviour> newBehaviours)
        Insert a list of new Behaviour at specific positions of the existing Human behaviours.
        Parameters:
        index - position at which newBehaviours will be inserted
        newBehaviours - a List of Behaviours to be inserted into the existing Human behaviours
